sentence.text: Here we report that positive regulation of protein ubiquitination ubiquitylates and triggers degradation of the tumor-suppressive sirtuin regulation of double-strand break repair via homologous recombination in hepatocellular carcinoma.

entity.text: regulation of double-strand break repair via homologous recombination

sentence.text: In mouse models of hepatocellular carcinoma, SIRT6 downregulation and consequent induction of positive regulation of receptor recycling were critical for positive regulation of protein ubiquitination-mediated tumorigenesis.

Furthermore, in clinical specimens, increased positive regulation of protein ubiquitination levels correlated with reduced regulation of double-strand break repair via homologous recombination levels and elevated positive regulation of receptor recycling levels in increasing tumor grades.

entity.text: regulation of double-strand break repair via homologous recombination

sentence.text: Overall, our findings show how the tumor suppressor regulation of double-strand break repair via homologous recombination is regulated in hepatocellular carcinoma and establish the mechanism underlying positive regulation of protein ubiquitination-mediated tumorigenesis in this disease.Significance: These findings provide mechanistic insights into regulation of the tumor suppressive sirtuin SIRT6 and its implications for the development of hepatocellular carcinoma.

entity.text: regulation of double-strand break repair via homologous recombination
